original_solution_mapping.L1: Lucy can read 20 more pages than Oliver who can read 40 pages so Lucy can read 40+20 = <<20+40=60>>60 pages
original_solution_mapping.L2: Carter can read half as many pages as Lucy who can read 60 pages so he can read 60/2 = <<30=30>>30 pages in 1 hour

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1359.
    Returns: the number of pages Carter can read in 1 hour.
    """
    # L1
    lucy_more_than_oliver = 20 # Lucy can read 20 more pages than Oliver
    oliver_pages = 40 # Oliver can read 40 pages
    lucy_pages = oliver_pages + lucy_more_than_oliver

    # L2
    half_divisor = 2 # half as many pages
    carter_pages = lucy_pages / half_divisor

    # FA
    answer = carter_pages
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Lucy can read {lucy_more_than_oliver} more pages than Oliver who can read {oliver_pages} pages so Lucy can read {oliver_pages}+{lucy_more_than_oliver} = <<{lucy_more_than_oliver}+{oliver_pages}={lucy_pages}>>{lucy_pages} pages
Carter can read half as many pages as Lucy who can read {lucy_pages} pages so he can read {lucy_pages}/{half_divisor} = <<{carter_pages}={carter_pages}>>{carter_pages} pages in 1 hour

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Lucy can read 20 more pages than Oliver who can read 40 pages so Lucy can read 40+20 = <<20+40=60>>60 pages
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Carter can read half as many pages as Lucy who can read 2 pages so he can read 2/2 = <<1=1>>1 pages in 1 hour

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'half_divisor' (value: 2) was used instead of 'lucy_pages' (value: 60).
